subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0032_01C9C25A.2FC0CEE0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

LOL!! It all right Frank. It's the little things that escape us. Besides, y=
our forte lies in other areas :)


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: =
Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, April 21, 2=
009 8:16 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR






   I am always so =
suprised at my lack of brain/intellect/perception! I had an old Radio Shack=
 digital voice recorder--it does the que and review, and so does the new on=
e. Huge DAH!

   I need to go the wizard and get a brain!

   F-S


  On Tu=
e, Apr 21, 2009 at 7:36 AM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghostresear=
ch.com> wrote:





    There are some that do have this capability. I beli=
eve mine does, though I have not used that function. I have the Olympus WM-=
300. It is a little more expensive brand new, I believe like $160 or someth=
ing, but I bought mine refurbished for $60.

    Anyway, I will try it to m=
ake sure, but I am pretty sure you can rewind and relisten, not having to g=
o back to the beginning.

    April

      ----- Original Message ----- 
  =
    From: Frank Sumption 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Mo=
nday, April 20, 2009 8:51 PM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR



=
      The only thing I don't like is that the digital recorders don't have =
que and review funtions that tape decks have, you can't back up and re-list=
en to a voice, you have to go back to the beginning, unless the file is cop=
ied the computer. 

       BTW, I don't do ghost hunts. 

       Frank-S


=
      On Mon, Apr 20, 2009 at 8:01 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombie=
ghostresearch.com> wrote:





        Oh LOL!! No...you are technically co=
rrect.

        There are 2 instruments that us ghost hunters have in our a=
rsenal that can go by the name of "DVR"; Digital Voice Recorder and Digital=
 Video Recorder.

        To save some confusion, some of us refer to a dig=
ital voice recorder as simply a voice recorder. I have gotten so used to th=
is term that I automatically think digital video recorder when I hear DVR.
=

        I also have an Olympus digital voice recorder. I LOVE it. In fact,=
 I have had many over the years. I have had other brands too, but Olympus r=
ecorders are the best, as far as the affordable versions go.

        April=


          ----- Original Message ----- 
          From: purplespacefriend=
 
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
          Sent: Monday, April 20, =
2009 7:40 PM
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR


          DVR, as=
 in digital voice recorder. I'm not usded to using this new techno stuff, s=
o maybe the terminology is wrong. Anyway, I got it at Sams, $60, and it doe=
s have an external mic jack. I made a line to mic level adapter so I can re=
cord directly from the boxes. This one has built in USB connector, so it co=
nnects directly the PC. It records in WMA format, and that is easliy conver=
ted to mp3, or played my windows media player. 

          F-S

          -=
-- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
     =
     >
          > You have to tell how much and were to get one. I need a =
new DVR for my night vision cameras. I need to be able to hook an external =
mic to it as well, as the cameras do not have audio capability. I was going=
 to buy the Radio Shack one as someone suggested to me. Which would be fine=
, but I would really like to have USB connection.
          > 
          > =
Does it have an internal harddrive?
          > 
          > April 


     =
     > 
          > ----- Original Message ----- 
          > From: Frank S=
umption 
          > To: grassharp@yahoogroups.com ; evp-itc@...=
m 
          > Sent: Sunday, April 19, 2009 9:43 PM
          > Subject: [E=
VP-ITC] A new DVR [7 Attachments]
          > 
          > 
          > [At=
tachment(s) from Frank Sumption included below] 
          > 
          > 
=
          > 
          > I bought a Radio Shack digital recored years, and =
never liked it much. I picked up an Olympus WS-21S this afternoon on a whim=
. I made a line to mic adapter, and did a couple box recordings. I don't kn=
ow, might be better than tape. I has the advantage of of built in USB conne=
ctor, and it records in WMA format. 
          > 
          > I tried a sho=
rt recording last night using the tones in 51, I don't think they help. 
  =
        > 
          > Frank-S
          >
